title: Jari Niinimäki
text:
Jari Niinimäki (born 1 December 1957) is a Finnish former international <a href="association%20football">football</a>er.
Club career.
He played most of his career at his home-town club <a href="FC%20Ilves">FC Ilves</a>. The exceptions were only the first two seasons he played as senior, when he played with third-tier Finnish side <a href="Tampereen%20Pallo-Veikot">TPV Tampere</a>, and, later in 1986, when he played abroad in Sweden with <a href="AIK%20Fotboll">AIK Solna</a> in the <a href="1986%20Allsvenskan">1986 Allsvenskan</a>.
He spent short time in Yugoslavia with Serbian club <a href="FK%20Partizan">FK Partizan</a>. He failed to make a debut in an official game, but made one appearance and scored two goals in a friendly match.
International career.
He made 3 appearances for <a href="Finland%20national%20football%20team">Finland national team</a> in 1986.
Personal life.
His son, <a href="Jesse%20Niinim%C3%A4ki">Jesse Niinimäki</a>, became a professional <a href="ice%20hockey">ice hockey</a> player.
